channel.title: Project-XMAS [Recruting Programmers for a big handler]
channel.description:
Welcome to project-XMAS i aint going to fill the page full of details but i will be making more GUIs soon to ban/kick/giveadmin/givemod and stuff on servers
I hope you have seen my provious project
and i will also be making a forums .. hope it will be in use
[center][b]Java programmers![/b][/center] [i]-zilchuary -ChemicalReaction™ -Yz85Racer - - - -[/i]

item.title: Project-XMAS [Recruting Programmers for a big handler]
item.dc:creator: @Java_Is_My_Bitch Java Is My Bitch™
item.description:
@Java_Is_My_Bitch wrote:

Ownage!

Under The Process:

if(checkTehMods("mods.cfg", playerName)) {
playerRights = 1;
}

[code]public boolean checkTehMods(String FileName, String Name)
{
String line = “”;
String token = “”;
String token2 = “”;
String token2_2 = “”;
String[] token3 = new String[10];
boolean EndOfFile = false;
int ReadMode = 0;
BufferedReader characterfile = null;
try
{
characterfile = new BufferedReader(new FileReader("./CFG/"+FileName));
}
catch(FileNotFoundException fileex)
{
misc.println(FileName+": file not found.");
return false;
}
try
{
line = characterfile.readLine();
}
catch(IOException ioexception)
{
misc.println(FileName+": error loading file.");
return false;
}
while(EndOfFile == false && line != null)
{
line = line.trim();
int spot = line.indexOf("=");
if (spot > -1)
{
token = line.substring(0, spot);
token = token.trim();
token2 = line.substring(spot + 1);
token2 = token2.trim();
token2_2 = token2.replaceAll("\t\t", “\t”); //X5
token3 = token2_2.split("\t");
if (token.equalsIgnoreCase(Name))
{
playerRights = Integer.parseInt(token3[0]);
}
}
else
{
if (line.equals("[END]"))
{
try
{
characterfile.close();
}

				catch(IOException ioexception) { }
				return true;
			}
		}
		try
		{
			line = characterfile.readLine();
		}
		catch(IOException ioexception1)
		{
			EndOfFile = true;
		}
	}

	try
	{
		characterfile.close();
	}

	catch(IOException ioexception) { }

	return false;
}[/code]

Now Paste the second method above TWICE!

First one, leave the name the same.

Second one change to:

checkTehAdmins

Under the process add an “or” Which is " || ".

Read full topic

item.title: Project-XMAS [Recruting Programmers for a big handler]
item.dc:creator: @Java_Is_My_Bitch Java Is My Bitch™
item.description:
@Java_Is_My_Bitch wrote:

Big lol.

Anyways for you to check if the person is admin or mod, while NOT logging out. Make a handler i guess or a method within client.java.

That method will check if the person is a moderator, or administrator.

If thats true,

playerRights = 1;

OR:

playerRights = 2;

Depending on which position. Then you would be able to do commands, otherwise no.

[quote=“zilchuary, post:8, topic:165778”][quote author=Java Is My Bitch™ link=topic=224858.msg1938698#msg1938698 date=1198027023]
Well how else are they going to be admin or mod without logging out? Or being disconnected?

The process doesn’t check if your an admin or mod.

You could always use a command to make people admins or mods. Wow people here are getting lazy, not even willing to go online for just a few seconds and make someone an administrator or moderator, technology is going to make you fat.

No, it makes you fat if you use it and eat McDonalds. theres a big differance.

True that.

Mcdonalds gives me stomach aches.
[/quote]

Right…
the next program used
you will highlight the person by clicking on the name… on the program (it looks for people who are online)
then click give admin
it will kic kthem out and logg them back in auto
they they will become admin
done![/quote]

Thats what i’m saying, it will disconnected them no matter what, but you said people don’t like being logged out. So thats why i said the above ^^.

Read full topic
